programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones hit the jackpot when they uncover a collection of gold bars and a replica medieval catapult at an auction in Hermosa Beach, California.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: Excuse Me, I Think You're Stupid
programme.desc: The competition gets fierce at an auction in Fort Worth, where Cowboy Matt and Kenny fight over an abandoned item of furniture.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Kenny acquires a locker full of martial arts equipment that puts him in a compromising position. Mary reveals the extent of her ambition and Jenny uses underhand tactics.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Frank and Mike talk their way into a salvage yard that has not been picked over for decades.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: A team catches an alligator that is supposedly cursed, and soon all the hunters are suffering bad luck, with one losing his ability to shoot and another suffering a serious bite.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: The rescue team struggles when a trailer carrying wood overturns on the carriageway. Later, a lorry transporting fine wine ends up at the bottom of a ravine.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team is presented with a fully functional armoured truck from the Second World War, a cheque signed by a notorious mobster, and a 1980s computer.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A computer meltdown threatens to bring the business to a standstill. Plus, the team is offered a cast iron Uncle Sam money box and comes face to face with a robosaurus.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon presents the comedy panel show, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guests Alex Jones, Chris Tarrant, Alexander Armstrong and Mel Giedroyc to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended episode of the panel show, in which Sandi Toksvig invites Lucy Beaumont, Jason Manford, Rhod Gilbert and Alan Davies to answer questions on subjects associated with the North and the Norse. Since the questions are impossible to answer, points are awarded for being interesting rather than correct.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: A ship from the 23rd century is washed up from the past and the Dwarfers run into a crew where criticism is illegal. When they protest they are arrested and threatened with draining of all critical thoughts. However, Rimmer's bitterness about his childhood comes in handy in beating the draining machine, his inner critic and the system, at least for a while. Johnny Vegas guest stars.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts another round of the peculiar panel quiz and asks a range of unusual questions about jobs, finding out how much Sarah Millican, David Mitchell, the Rev Richard Coles and regular panellist Alan Davies know about the subject.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim and Gendle revisit the best moments from the series' 11 stunts, the biggest wins and losses and there are even some previously unseen moments.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher helps cellmate Godber make it through the night, calling on his unpredictable and limitless imagination to while away the hours. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How, in 1940, the French Army suffered a heavy defeat after underestimating the Nazis' strength while relying on First World War strategies and equipment to defend its frontiers. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The history of pioneering modern-day mega structures, revealing that behind every seemingly impossible marvel of modern engineering is a cast of historic trailblazing engineers who designed new building techniques, took risks on untested materials and revolutionised their field. The first programme focuses on the aircraft carrier.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre examines how continued success for the unit could only be achieved with ever more dangerous and ambitious missions, while David Stirling's new second-in-command Captain Paddy Mayne was an officer as unpredictable and dangerous as the phase of war that was about to begin. The historian also reveals how many SAS members were captured by the Germans - and hears the extraordinary story of two of them who outran their pursuers by surviving for three days in the desert without food or fresh water.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre concludes his history of formation of the British Army special forces unit. With David Stirling locked away in Hitler's most secure prison Colditz, the leadership of the SAS passed to Paddy Mayne, a man who built his reputation on the battlefield as a warrior of the first rank. In 1943, the SAS leaves the desert for Europe to enter a darker and far more complex theatre of war, where they face the threat of execution and the trauma of civilian casualties, as well as being the first to witness the nightmare of Bergen-Belsen concentration camp.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Herbert Rowse Armstrong, who was convicted of murdering his wife with arsenic. Much of the evidence against him was circumstantial and the scientific testimony remains disputed. This episode examines both sides of the case and asks whether the British justice system made a terrible mistake.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The story of Major General Robert Laycock who rallied his ill-equipped troops to see off a German attack on Crete, Greece.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How, in 1940, the French Army suffered a heavy defeat after underestimating the Nazis' strength while relying on First World War strategies and equipment to defend its frontiers. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A towering structure with an explosive past, a deserted cityscape, a mysterious top-secret facility and a vast Nazi construction.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Rare footage of the elusive animals that live in the unforgiving environment of the world's mountain ranges. A female snow leopard with a cub ends up caught between two rival males, grizzly bears rub themselves up against trees in an attempt to shed their winter fur, and golden eagles hunt over snow-capped peaks.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Chris Tarrant on the Polar Express
programme.desc: Chris sets out to reach the northernmost railway station on Earth, inside Russia's Arctic Circle. This is an epic 2,000-mile adventure from Moscow into Arctic Siberia, and begins with a marathon 19-hour leg. Along the way he enjoys a reindeer stew with a local family and takes the controls of one of the massive locomotives that power the trains, before pressing on along railways built under the brutal regime of Joseph Stalin.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.sub-title: To the Ends of the Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough travels to the Arctic and Antarctic to explore the wildernesses at Earth's poles, investigating the wildlife and geographical features found there. He begins by travelling to the North Pole, where two polar bears reveal a surprisingly tender side to their characters, before heading to the South Pole - 100 years after Roald Amundsen and Robert Falcon Scott first reached it.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of plants and animals that live in jungles, one of the hardest environments to thrive in, including strange fungi and creatures that glow in the dark which have never been captured on film before. The programme also includes recordings of caimans and the jaguars that prey on them, freshwater dolphins that swim through flooded forests, undergrowth-dwelling frogs that have to defend themselves against wasps, and the Indri, the world's largest living lemur, which inhabits the forests of Madagascar.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of Kansai International Airport upon the largest man-made island in the world, in Osaka Bay, Japan. Pioneering innovators from the past such as Pierre Danel, who developed a system against the pounding sea, and 19th-century mechanic Richard Dudgeon made the project possible. The development of airports including Berlin's Tempelhof Airport and London's Croydon Airport are also explored to reveal how engineers attempted this feat of engineering..

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: How Field Marshall Erich von Manstein's escape from the Red Army influenced Nato's defence plans.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The drop in morale of Churchill's forces following the fall of France to Nazi forces during the Second World War, and how the Dunkirk evacuation and the Battle of Britain helped to restore British confidence. Plus, America's reasons for initially refusing to enter the conflict.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An American prison for the violent and deranged with links to an infamous cult leader, and a cavernous tunnel network in France offering shelter from unrelenting bombardment.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Falkirk wheel is the first and only rotating boat lift, capable of moving 600 tonnes of boat and water over a 25-metre height difference in just minutes.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Crafty con Fletcher helps new inmate Godber settle in by giving him a few lessons on coping with prison life. First episode of the classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1974, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Betting fever sweeps Slade Prison, but the stakes rise too high for some of the inmates, stretching honour among thieves to the limit. Vintage comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher helps cellmate Godber make it through the night, calling on his unpredictable and limitless imagination to while away the hours. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Edmund Blackadder, conniving courtier to Elizabeth I, takes in a spirited lad as his manservant - unaware the fellow is actually a woman out to make her fortune. Classic comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson, Miranda Richardson and Stephen Fry, with a guest appearance by Rik Mayall as Edmund's best friend Lord Flashheart.

credits.actor: a guest appearance by Rik Mayall as Edmund's best friend Lord Flashheart

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Edmund is appointed Lord High Executioner and moves a beheading forward from Wednesday to Monday so he and his staff can enjoy some time off. Unfortunately, he didn't take into account the Queen's tendency to change her mind. Comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson, Tony Robinson and Miranda Richardson.

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: Edmund becomes jealous of the adulation that a boastful Sir Walter Raleigh has been receiving in court since his return from the New World. Attempting to impress the queen, he announces his intention to go on a voyage around the Cape of Good Hope, but his choice of captain leaves a lot to be desired. Comedy, guest starring Tom Baker and Simon Jones, with Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Barging Round Britain with John Sergeant
programme.desc: The broadcaster leaves central Manchester, heading east along the Rochdale Canal. Not long into his journey, John finds himself struggling to contend with 19th-century technology at a cotton works. Further up the canal, he helps out members of an conservation group clearing the waterway of dumped supermarket trollies. After passing into West Yorkshire, it's on to Hebden Bridge, famous for the hard-wearing material corduroy, before John tries his hand at clog-making in one of Britain's few remaining factories dedicated to the craft.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The GMB team is joined by Lorraine Kelly for the final hour, with the latest on the coronavirus pandemic, as well as other stories.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Another helping of topical studio discussion from a female perspective, featuring celebrity interviews.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: This time, the chef travels to south Wales, where he is accompanied by Michelin-starred chef Stephen Terry. James cooks a Welsh lamb ragu on a beautiful mountainside, and samples award-winning Welsh wine and organic Welsh chocolate. Later, he visits Shaun Hill at his renowned restaurant, The Walnut Tree.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a family from Birmingham answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Long-running soap following the ups and downs of village life amid the rolling scenery of the Yorkshire Dales.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Long-running drama with the residents of England's most famous cobbled street.

programme.title: Kate & Koji
programme.desc: When Kate's flashy ex-husband Dennis arrives in town with his much younger wife, Kate feigns an attachment to Koji. Councillor Bone is sure their relationship is a front, but that does not stop a good old-fashioned show down at the pub. Comedy, starring Brenda Blethyn, Jimmy Akingbola and Barbara Flynn.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul helps to feed a pair of week-old kittens whose mother has abandoned them. However, as the kittens grow older, the team discover that one of them has a neurological problem affecting his movement. Later, Paul meets a group of dogs from a puppy farm who have had very little human interaction in the past, and need help learning how to socialise.

programme.title: Quiz
programme.desc: Persecuted and hounded by the public and press, Charles, Diana and Tecwen head to court. At first it seems the case for the prosecution is solid, but as the case for the defence gets underway, the jury learn there is far more to the story than they first thought. Drama, starring Matthew Macfadyen and Sian Clifford.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.title: Quiz
programme.desc: Persecuted and hounded by the public and press, Charles, Diana and Tecwen head to court. programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Work continues on the Austin Mini's restoration, as Edd China and Mike Brewer prepare to return the car to the road.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: A French museum asks eccentric military equipment collector Bruce Crompton for help in acquiring an incredibly rare German Panzer 1 tank. He also explores the remains of secret underground Nazi war factorie.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The crew build a custom chopper for Kobalt Tools and Paul Jr gathers the family for a life-changing announcement.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Kevin green lights Heather's first solo repo, to which she pays the price for her mistakes. Meanwhile, Mike returns to Puerto Rico to recover a relic from the old family business.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe works at an exotic animal ranch in Texas, but has trouble getting along with its wallabies and lemurs. However, his toughest challenge involves trimming a bearcat's claws.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The complex manufacturing processes behind the production of mouth-blown window glass, water pumps, sake, and tweezers.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The documentary outlining various manufacturing processes continues, this time focusing on statue restoration, and the production of tripods, Polish sausages and welding guns.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex processes that allow people to build diesel engines that can fly, make cough sweets, turn clear plastic into unforgeable bank notes, and produce ice-cream.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard spots a 1960s Mini that may be for sale - can he buy it at a good price? Plus, a Cotswold dealer has a Porsche 928, but the budget is hit by some major repairs.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Deckhand Jake suffers an injury as the Northwestern's crew struggles to keep up with the maniacal pace of Captain Sig.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: This winter, strict deadlines force the fleet to take extreme measures. Vern gambles on an advanced dredge and Emily unleashes a team of all-girl divers on Nome.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer travels to Yorkshire to examine a TVR S2 that is up for auction.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China experiences a series of problems while working on the TVR S2, which leaves Mike Brewer wondering if it will be ready for him in time to sell at a profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer finds a Land Rover Discovery for 1,500 and hands it over to mechanic Edd China for restoration work.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mechanic Edd China finishes working on the Land Rover Discovery and, after a successful road test, Mike Brewer has a buyer lined up.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini takes a look at the hottest parties happening at the Pebble Beach Concours d'Elegance.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini is hired to sell an Eliminator roadster, owned by automotive journalist Brock Yates, but he must first pick the vehicle up from the Saratoga Automobile Museum.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Derek Hill - the son of legendary auto racer Phil Hill - brings his father's 1912 Packard to the Pebble Beach Concours d'Elegance.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini searches for more high-end resoration projects, and uncovers numerous Mopar cars, a 1905 Cadillac and a Ferrari 330

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: In Hampshire, Drew Pritchard and Paul Cowland uncover a rare 1960s MGC, but clash over how to restyle it. In Dorset, they fall for an '80s BMW 635 Coupe left in a barn for 15 years.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: On the west coast of Cornwall, Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove open many sheds in grey, full of classics in all stages of decay. Searching through 50 years of accumulated vintage vehicles, they find the first ever Lotus Elan and a pre-war Sunbeam.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove head to Oxfordshire, where everything the pair look at is oversized and likely over-priced. However, Henry likes a tractor in blue and Sam falls for a Midget racer in a hedge.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce Crompton helps a Texan millionaire who wants to collect memorabilia from the Battle of Normandy. He visits farmhouses and museums to find rare items like a 1942 Luger.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a dealer specialising in house clearances, and in Sheffield spots industrial furniture at a 19th-century factory. Later, he finds old punk collectable.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The artisan restorers revamp a fragile standing mirror needing some love, a classic armchair and a large railway station clock. Rebecca Pritchard examines their origins.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China embark on a project to restore an original Austin Mini.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Work continues on the Austin Mini's restoration, as Edd China and Mike Brewer prepare to return the car to the road.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects. The bigger the hoard, the happier he is.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard gets to drive a 1940s steam engine, and visits a country house to look for more potentially valuable items.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard teams up with Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland for a motoring mission. They scour the UK, buying, restoring and selling classic cars.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Skilled 'pickers' Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz get a lead on what could be Aerosmith's original tour van, prompting them to head out on a cross-country trek in search of the rock 'n' roll relic.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.sub-title: Artificial Reefs/Earthquake-Proof Buildings/Cars on Rocket Fuel
programme.desc: The creation of an artificial reef by sinking an old warship, the plan to minimise damage to San Francisco when the next earthquake strikes the city and how to run a car on rocket fuel.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How pilots prevent blackouts during high G-force turns, and a look at a robot that can thwart car thieves' chances of escape.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China are fixing up a Mercedes 230E, which is in need of a new wing.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer and Edd China continue working on getting the second-hand Mercedes 230E back on the road.

programme.title: The Detectives: My Killer Case
programme.sub-title: Andrew Scanlan: Murder In The Woods
programme.desc: Disturbing crimes from across the UK are unpacked and retold in intimate detail through police files, CCTV footage and accounts from those who helped solve them.

programme.title: The Detectives: My Killer Case
programme.desc: Disturbing crimes from across the UK are unpacked and retold in intimate detail through police files, CCTV footage and accounts from those who helped solve them.

programme.title: The Detectives: My Killer Case
programme.desc: Disturbing crimes from across the UK are unpacked and retold in intimate detail through police files, CCTV footage and accounts from those who helped solve them.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Operation Shattered Shield, an undercover investigation to root out corruption in the New Orleans Police Department.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Officers fight to save a sick and neglected horse.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown pays a visit to Kyabram Vet Clinic in the state of Victoria to lend a hand to an old friend.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kate heads to the salon with an entourage that includes her father, and Nancy takes advice from her fashionista dad, as both brides try to find the perfect dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Lori seeks out the perfect dress for an insecure bridesmaid with body image issues, while Emily's insulting outbursts threaten to ruin her friendships.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride fights her mother for control of the dress choice while a military bride argues over how her maids should look.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Holly wants to look like a princess, but her mother and grandma have other ideas, while Lauren has yet to lay eyes on her custom-made ballgown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A customer invites her fiance's ex-girlfriend to the salon, and while Tracy wants a short dress, her partner would prefer her to have a long gown.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
programme.desc: Lacey wants a dress that will show off her very large back tattoo, but her mother wants it fully covered.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: Two Mums Are Better Than None
programme.desc: The competition gets fierce when Hannah brings both her mum and stepmother to help her choose a dress, while Kourtney suffers due to her mother's absence.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown must work out the best solution for a pup's badly deformed leg, a cat is brought in after being run over, and Tim and Julie are busy collecting koala dung.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown treats a deadly patient - a huge king brown snake that has bitten its own tail - and Andrew checks out a rescue dog with badly deformed back legs.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The search for a murder suspect that led police to arrest two conspirators involved in the plot, who later implicated the victim's ex-husband.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: An explanation of how difficult it is to determine the cause of death in victims who have been subdued with sedatives.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How victims' family members and friends can assist police in their inquiries after the body of a missing person is found and identified.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A devastating house fire results in the deaths of a man and his stepchildren, and investigators try to determine whether the tragic incident was the result of arson.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: The story of Octavia, who was bedbound for nearly a year before seeking help. With her best friend also her worst enabler, can she choose between old habits and a new life?.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Susan is committed to drastic weight loss, but when a medical disorder affects her mobility, her plight becomes a matter of life and death.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three rivals head to a market in Le Val, south-east France, to see who can buy the best bargains with 800 euros. Alison discovers an old birdcage that she plans to clean up as a decorative item. Meanwhile, Alys is taken with an antique rocking horse, and Louise spruces up a hall coat stand before heading to auction in Clapham, south-west London.

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: Managing director James heads to Lanzarote to tackle his biggest deal yet - the sale of a 1.5million yellow submarine. A jeweller to the stars wants to pawn her collection to expand her business, while Lawrence appraises a guitar with links to punk band the Sex Pistols owned by a former millionaire who's now living in a bedsit. A doting father-to-be decides to get rid of his pride-and-joy black Ferrari to buy a family home.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Estranged brothers John and Lonnie are complete opposites. Now, they're united by their need to lose weight while they still can - and save their relationship.

programme.title: Saving Babies
programme.desc: The ups and downs of having premature twins, as first-time parents Laura and Ryan cope with having two babies on the neonatal unit who were born 14 weeks early.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: Fatima is allergic to light and even indoors must take precautions to avoid succumbing to skin cancer. Meanwhile, Amar's face has been destroyed by a bony tumour.

programme.title: 10 Steps to Murder
programme.desc: A millionaires mid-life crisis leads to an unthinkable tragedy when he strangles a prostitute. Detectives and the killers brother reveal the steps that led to murder. S1/1/10

programme.title: 10 Steps to Murder
programme.desc: The shocking discovery of 80-year-old Lea Adri-Soejoko's body in an allotment shed unraveled a tragic story. Detectives and her family recount the steps that led to her murder.
